page.title: 05Village Life - Then & Now
page.content: The group recorded an interview with one of Tempsford oldest inhabitants.Mr.J.Gosling is invovled in village life in a number of ways.He told us just how the village has changed in his lifetime. Mr. Gosling family has farmed in Tempford for centuries.The present day population of the village is around 400 this figure being more or less static since the turn of the century.Soon after world war one 30 council houses were built to replace much older properties.Today a small number of private houses have been built in the village but only on an infilling basis.The former country residence of the Stuart family Tempsford Hall was rebuilt after being gutted by fire in 1898 this stands on high ground surrounded by 100 acres of parkland.
